jobs.title: Senior / Staff Backend Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Kindred is a members-only home swapping network that unlocks the ability to live a travel-rich lifestyle through the power of community. By exchanging primary residences with trusted peers, renters and owners alike can match with Kindred spirits and explore new destinations without breaking the bank.

We are on a mission to build a sharing economy that lives up to the name, and we’ve raised significant capital from some of the best investors in Silicon Valley, including Index Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, New Enterprise Associates, Bessemer Venture Partners, Caffeinated Capital, Elad Gil, and the founders of Opendoor, Figma, ClassPass, Clubhouse, Divvy, Gem, and Homebound.

The co-founders are proven leaders from the early team at proptech company Opendoor ($15B+ exit) and have each separately built and scaled products that today do $1B+ annual revenue combined.

We’re looking for the world’s top builders, executors, and believers to join us on this ride.

You can learn more about us in Forbes and TechCrunch.

The Role:

We’re looking for a world-class engineer with deep experience in backend software development to join our team.

We're looking for a thought partner who is motivated by the opportunity to build an iconic consumer product that will shape the future of travel.

What You'll Do:

  • Serve as technology lead and own key decisions including the tech stack and strategy for backend design, data infrastructure, and machine learning investments.

  • Work directly with product, design, and other engineers to build out our platform.

  • Help establish and grow our engineering organization and mentor the next generation of technology leaders.

You may be a right fit for this role if you:

  • Have 5+ years of technical experience as a backend software engineer.

  • Have experience crafting robust backends and database structures that can both scale with user volume as well as business complexity.

  • Have some experience with devops (setting up CI/CD, containerization, etc.)

  • Have worked with service providers like AWS, configured CDNs, used Heroku, etc.

  • Have demonstrated success operating as a tech lead on critical projects at previous roles.

  • Have prior experience at a high-growth stage company.

  • Are an entrepreneur at heart who is excited about bringing new experiences to the world.

  • Are motivated by consumer products and building platforms that become cornerstones of consumer behavior.

  • Have the ability to exercise strong judgment and make difficult technical tradeoff decisions.

  • Are an excellent listener and strong communicator, working well cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment.

  • Are comfortable with uncertainty and ambiguity.

  • Enjoy the process of making something new and unknown.

  • Have a pragmatic approach to engineering — you’re not dogmatic and know how to choose the best tool or process for the job at hand.

  • Come to work with energy, humility, and positivity.

Our Benefits:

At Kindred, we know that good things happen when we look out for one another. We offer our employees the following benefits:

  • Our opening spans more than one career level. The base salary offered depends on many factors, such as work experience, transferable skills, business needs and impact, and market demands.

  • A vibrant, inclusive, and highly skilled team that ferociously protects team chemistry

  • A culture of championship (vs. just mentorship), feedback, and continual development

  • Competitive cash compensation and equity

  • Comprehensive health benefits

  • Flexible vacation policy

  • Unlimited credits to stay at Kindred homes during your time as an employee

  • $4,000 annual travel stipend to use toward travel costs to stay at a Kindred home

  • Remote-flexible work environment. We encourage team members to travel and adventure, including working from Kindred HQ in San Francisco!

  • Regular offsites to co-locate with the team

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. Kindred does not discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic, including race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, genetic information, family care or medical leave status, marital status, domestic partner status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by US federal, state or local laws, or the laws of the country or jurisdiction where you work. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

jobs.title: Senior / Staff Frontend Engineer (Web & Mobile)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Kindred is a members-only home swapping network that unlocks the ability to live a travel-rich lifestyle through the power of community. By exchanging primary residences with trusted peers, renters and owners alike can match with Kindred spirits and explore new destinations without breaking the bank.

We are on a mission to build a sharing economy that lives up to the name, and we’ve raised significant capital from some of the best investors in Silicon Valley, including Index Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, New Enterprise Associates, Bessemer Venture Partners, Caffeinated Capital, Elad Gil, and the founders of Opendoor, Figma, ClassPass, Clubhouse, Divvy, Gem, and Homebound.

The co-founders are proven leaders from the early team at proptech company Opendoor ($15B+ exit) and have each separately built and scaled products that today do $1B+ annual revenue combined.

We’re looking for the world’s top builders, executors, and believers to join us on this ride.

You can learn more about us in Forbes and TechCrunch.

The Role:

We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Software Engineer with deep expertise in building dynamic, consumer-facing applications using both React for web and React Native for mobile. As one of our early engineering hires, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping our product across platforms and have the chance to significantly influence our technical roadmap. You'll be a key player bridging our web and mobile experiences, ensuring a cohesive and high-quality user journey. We're looking for a thought partner motivated by the opportunity to build an iconic consumer product that will shape the future of travel.

What You'll Do:

  • Serve as a technology leader, contributing to key decisions regarding tech stack and strategy across both web (Next.js) and mobile (React Native) development.

  • Work directly with the co-founders, CTO, product designers, and fellow engineers to build and iterate on the Kindred platform.

  • Architect, build, test, and scale features across our Next.js web application and React Native mobile app.

  • Develop reusable UI components and contribute to our cross-platform design system thinking.

  • Optimize applications for performance, scalability, and responsiveness on both web and mobile.

  • Integrate with backend APIs, ensuring seamless data flow and user experience.

  • Help establish and grow our engineering organization, including mentoring future engineers.

  • Have access to our bench of world-class technical advisors and angels for mentorship and support as needed.

You may be a right fit for this role if you:

  • Have 5+ years of technical experience building consumer-facing applications, with significant expertise in both React (web) and React Native (mobile).

  • Have experience building, testing, and scaling large-scale web and mobile applications.

  • Are proficient in JavaScript, TypeScript, and modern frontend/mobile tooling (e.g., Webpack, Metro, Tailwind CSS).

  • Have experience architecting scalable frontend and mobile solutions. Experience with Next.js is a strong plus.

  • Possess an understanding of native mobile app toolchains (iOS/Android) and their integration with React Native.

  • Have experience building scalable and reusable UI components, ideally with experience contributing to or using design systems.

  • Have a strong attention to detail in UI implementation and a deep understanding of consumer-facing UX principles across web and mobile.

  • Are skilled in performance optimization techniques for both web and mobile.

  • Have demonstrated success operating as a tech lead or senior individual contributor on critical projects in previous roles.

  • Have prior experience at a high-growth stage company.

  • Are an entrepreneur at heart who is excited about bringing new experiences to the world.

  • Are motivated by consumer products and building platforms that become cornerstones of consumer behavior.

  • Have the ability to exercise strong judgment and make difficult technical tradeoff decisions.

  • Are an excellent listener and strong communicator, working well cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment.

  • Are comfortable with uncertainty and ambiguity, enjoying the process of making something new and unknown.

  • Have a pragmatic approach to engineering — you’re not dogmatic and know how to choose the best tool or process for the job at hand.

  • Come to work with energy, humility, and positivity.

Our Benefits:

At Kindred, we know that good things happen when we look out for one another. We offer our employees the following benefits:

  • Our opening spans more than one career level. The base salary offered depends on many factors, such as work experience, transferable skills, business needs and impact, and market demands.

  • A vibrant, inclusive, and highly skilled team that ferociously protects team chemistry

  • A culture of championship (vs. just mentorship), feedback, and continual development

  • Competitive cash compensation and equity

  • Comprehensive health benefits

  • Flexible vacation policy

  • Unlimited credits to stay at Kindred homes during your time as an employee

  • $4,000 annual travel stipend to use toward travel costs to stay at a Kindred home

  • Remote-flexible work environment. We encourage team members to travel and adventure, including working from Kindred HQ in San Francisco!

  • Regular offsites to co-locate with the team

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. Kindred does not discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic, including race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, genetic information, family care or medical leave status, marital status, domestic partner status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by US federal, state or local laws, or the laws of the country or jurisdiction where you work. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

jobs.title: Senior / Staff Data Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Kindred is a members-only home swapping network that unlocks the ability to live a travel-rich lifestyle through the power of community. By exchanging primary residences with trusted peers, renters and owners alike can match with Kindred spirits and explore new destinations without breaking the bank.

We are on a mission to build a sharing economy that lives up to the name, and we’ve raised significant capital from some of the best investors in Silicon Valley, including Index Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, New Enterprise Associates, Bessemer Venture Partners, Caffeinated Capital, Elad Gil, and the founders of Opendoor, Figma, ClassPass, Clubhouse, Divvy, Gem, and Homebound.

The co-founders are proven leaders from the early team at proptech company Opendoor ($15B+ exit) and have each separately built and scaled products that today do $1B+ annual revenue combined.

We’re looking for the world’s top builders, executors, and believers to join us on this ride.

You can learn more about us in Forbes and TechCrunch.

The Role:

We’re looking for a world-class data engineer with deep experience in building scalable data infrastructure to join us at the ground floor.

You’ll be one of the earliest members of our data engineering team, shaping the foundation of Kindred’s data platform. This is an opportunity to build an iconic consumer product and a category-defining business that reshapes how people travel.

What You'll Do:

  • Play a key role in shaping the vision, architecture, and implementation of our end-to-end data infrastructure

  • Partner with engineering, product, and business leaders to understand data needs and influence the long-term data architecture

  • Build scalable, reliable data pipelines that support analytics, operations, and product experiences

  • Design and implement efficient batch and real-time data flows to power reporting, insights, and automation

  • Collaborate with software engineers to instrument key events and ensure data is captured cleanly and consistently

  • Develop well-modeled, intuitive data layers that make it easy for others to query and consume data

  • Implement quality checks, monitoring, and alerts to ensure trust in the data

  • Continuously optimize pipelines and workflows for performance, cost, and maintainability

  • Play a key role in growing our data engineering capabilities as we scale — including mentoring others and setting foundational practices

  • Contribute to incident response and support rotational coverage when needed to maintain data uptime and reliability

You may be a right fit for this role if you:

  • Have 5+ years of experience building and maintaining data infrastructure at scale

  • Are fluent in modern data tools and cloud-native ecosystems (e.g. dbt, Airflow, Snowflake/BigQuery, Kafka, Spark, etc.)

  • Have experience designing dimensional data models and optimizing warehouse performance

  • Have partnered closely with analytics, product, or ML teams to deliver clean, reliable, well-documented data

  • Have built data platforms from the ground up or been a key contributor in a high-growth startup environment

  • Are pragmatic and quality-driven — you know when to ship scrappy and when to build for scale

  • Are excited about working cross-functionally to turn ambiguous business problems into concrete data solutions

  • Thrive in early-stage environments with high ownership, autonomy, and rapid change

  • Are motivated by building elegant systems that empower others — not just crunching numbers

  • Come to work with curiosity, humility, and a collaborative spirit

Our Benefits:

At Kindred, we know that good things happen when we look out for one another. We offer our employees the following benefits:

  • Our opening spans more than one career level. The base salary offered depends on many factors, such as work experience, transferable skills, business needs and impact, and market demands.

  • A vibrant, inclusive, and highly skilled team that ferociously protects team chemistry

  • A culture of championship (vs. just mentorship), feedback, and continual development

  • Competitive cash compensation and equity

  • Comprehensive health benefits

  • Flexible vacation policy

  • Unlimited credits to stay at Kindred homes during your time as an employee

  • $4,000 annual travel stipend to use toward travel costs to stay at a Kindred home

  • Remote-flexible work environment. We encourage team members to travel and adventure, including working from Kindred HQ in San Francisco!

  • Regular offsites to co-locate with the team

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. Kindred does not discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic, including race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, genetic information, family care or medical leave status, marital status, domestic partner status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by US federal, state or local laws, or the laws of the country or jurisdiction where you work. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

 - A culture of championship (vs. just mentorship), feedback, and continual development

 - Competitive cash compensation and equity

 - Comprehensive health benefits

 - Flexible vacation policy

 - Unlimited credits to stay at Kindred homes during your time as an employee

 - $4,000 annual travel stipend to use toward travel costs to stay at a Kindred home

 - Remote-flexible work environment. We encourage team members to travel and adventure, including working from Kindred HQ in San Francisco!

 - Regular offsites to co-locate with the team

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. Kindred does not discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic, including race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, genetic information, family care or medical leave status, marital status, domestic partner status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by US federal, state or local laws, or the laws of the country or jurisdiction where you work. jobs.title: Staff Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Kindred is a members-only home swapping network that unlocks the ability to live a travel-rich lifestyle through the power of community. By exchanging primary residences with trusted peers, renters and owners alike can match with Kindred spirits and explore new destinations without breaking the bank.

We are on a mission to build a sharing economy that lives up to the name, and we’ve raised significant capital from some of the best investors in Silicon Valley, including Index Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, New Enterprise Associates, Bessemer Venture Partners, Caffeinated Capital, Elad Gil, and the founders of Opendoor, Figma, ClassPass, Clubhouse, Divvy, Gem, and Homebound.

The co-founders are proven leaders from the early team at proptech company Opendoor ($15B+ exit) and have each separately built and scaled products that today do $1B+ annual revenue combined.

We’re looking for the world’s top builders, executors, and believers to join us on this ride.

You can learn more about us in Forbes and TechCrunch.

The Role:

We’re looking for a Staff Product Manager to help shape the future of travel. This is a high-impact, strategic role where you'll work closely with our co-founders and a full-stack team to solve complex, deeply human challenges—like how to make hosting your personal home feel natural, how to scale a community without compromising quality, and how to create systems that serve both sides of a marketplace.

We’re looking for someone with deep consumer intuition and empathy and an exceptionally user-centric approach to problem-solving. This is fast-paced, intellectually demanding, and emotionally meaningful work—with the potential to reshape how people travel and connect.

What You’ll Do:

  • Own and lead key areas of the core product experience (e.g. growth, search & discovery, hosting) with a team of 8-10 engineers.

  • Design systems that build trust, balance marketplace dynamics, and drive measurable outcomes for both our members and the business.

  • Lead 0→1 and 1→n initiatives across surfaces that require speed, creativity, and craft.

  • Use data to size opportunities, uncover insights, and evaluate performance (both qualitative and quantitative).

  • Rigorously prioritize to focus the team on the highest-impact problems.

  • Collaborate closely with design, engineering, data and other cross-functional partners to scope, build, and ship products.

  • Champion product quality, simplicity, and craft.

  • Deeply understand and advocate for member needs.

You may be a right fit for this role if you:

  • Have 8+ years of product management experience, with at least some in consumer-facing products.

  • Have led 0→1 product development and/or scaled products at a high-growth startup.

  • Have a proven track record of driving measurable impact on key business metrics.

  • Combine strategic product thinking with strong execution—able to move quickly without sacrificing quality.

  • Have strong intuition for UX and user behavior and what makes a product feel exceptional.

  • Are able to leverage qualitative and quantitative data to inform decisions at every stage of the product lifecycle.

  • Are energized by ambiguity and thrive in fast-paced, high-ownership environments.

  • Care deeply about product polish, with a sharp eye for interaction design, visual design and product positioning.

  • Operate with a founder mindset—proactive, resourceful, and not above rolling up your sleeves to make things happen.

  • Bonus: experience working with consumer marketplace products.

  • Bonus: experience working with mobile products.

Our Benefits:

At Kindred, we know that good things happen when we look out for one another. We offer our employees the following benefits:

  • Our opening spans more than one career level. The base salary offered depends on many factors, such as work experience, transferable skills, business needs and impact, and market demands.

  • A vibrant, inclusive, and highly skilled team that ferociously protects team chemistry

  • A culture of championship (vs. just mentorship), feedback, and continual development

  • Competitive cash compensation and equity

  • Comprehensive health benefits

  • Flexible vacation policy

  • Unlimited credits to stay at Kindred homes during your time as an employee

  • $4,000 annual travel stipend to use toward travel costs to stay at a Kindred home

  • Remote-flexible work environment. We encourage team members to travel and adventure, including working from Kindred HQ in San Francisco!

  • Regular offsites to co-locate with the team

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. Kindred does not discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic, including race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, genetic information, family care or medical leave status, marital status, domestic partner status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by US federal, state or local laws, or the laws of the country or jurisdiction where you work. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
jobs.descriptionPlain:
Kindred is a members-only home swapping network that unlocks the ability to live a travel-rich lifestyle through the power of community. By exchanging primary residences with trusted peers, renters and owners alike can match with Kindred spirits and explore new destinations without breaking the bank.

We are on a mission to build a sharing economy that lives up to the name, and we’ve raised significant capital from some of the best investors in Silicon Valley, including Index Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, New Enterprise Associates, Bessemer Venture Partners, Caffeinated Capital, Elad Gil, and the founders of Opendoor, Figma, ClassPass, Clubhouse, Divvy, Gem, and Homebound.

The co-founders are proven leaders from the early team at proptech company Opendoor ($15B+ exit) and have each separately built and scaled products that today do $1B+ annual revenue combined.

We’re looking for the world’s top builders, executors, and believers to join us on this ride.

You can learn more about us in Forbes https://www.forbes.com/sites/bridgetarsenault/2022/06/10/a-new-home-swapping-platform-allows-you-to-travel-the-world-like-cameron-diaz-and-kate-winslet/?sh=203a5d0722cb and TechCrunch https://techcrunch.com/2023/04/19/opendoor-alums-raise-15m-for-kindred-a-home-swapping-network/.

The Role:

We’re looking for a Staff Product Manager to help shape the future of travel. This is a high-impact, strategic role where you'll work closely with our co-founders and a full-stack team to solve complex, deeply human challenges—like how to make hosting your personal home feel natural, how to scale a community without compromising quality, and how to create systems that serve both sides of a marketplace.

We’re looking for someone with deep consumer intuition and empathy and an exceptionally user-centric approach to problem-solving. This is fast-paced, intellectually demanding, and emotionally meaningful work—with the potential to reshape how people travel and connect.

What You’ll Do:

 - Own and lead key areas of the core product experience (e.g. growth, search & discovery, hosting) with a team of 8-10 engineers.

 - Design systems that build trust, balance marketplace dynamics, and drive measurable outcomes for both our members and the business.

 - Lead 0→1 and 1→n initiatives across surfaces that require speed, creativity, and craft.

 - Use data to size opportunities, uncover insights, and evaluate performance (both qualitative and quantitative).

 - Rigorously prioritize to focus the team on the highest-impact problems.

 - Collaborate closely with design, engineering, data and other cross-functional partners to scope, build, and ship products.

 - Champion product quality, simplicity, and craft.

 - Deeply understand and advocate for member needs.

You may be a right fit for this role if you:

 - Have 8+ years of product management experience, with at least some in consumer-facing products.

 - Have led 0→1 product development and/or scaled products at a high-growth startup.

 - Have a proven track record of driving measurable impact on key business metrics.

 - Combine strategic product thinking with strong execution—able to move quickly without sacrificing quality.

 - Have strong intuition for UX and user behavior and what makes a product feel exceptional.

 - Are able to leverage qualitative and quantitative data to inform decisions at every stage of the product lifecycle.

 - Are energized by ambiguity and thrive in fast-paced, high-ownership environments.

 - Care deeply about product polish, with a sharp eye for interaction design, visual design and product positioning.

 - Operate with a founder mindset—proactive, resourceful, and not above rolling up your sleeves to make things happen.

 - Bonus: experience working with consumer marketplace products.

 - Bonus: experience working with mobile products.


OUR BENEFITS:

At Kindred, we know that good things happen when we look out for one another. We offer our employees the following benefits:

 - Our opening spans more than one career level. The base salary offered depends on many factors, such as work experience, transferable skills, business needs and impact, and market demands.

 - A vibrant, inclusive, and highly skilled team that ferociously protects team chemistry

 - A culture of championship (vs. just mentorship), feedback, and continual development

 - Competitive cash compensation and equity

 - Comprehensive health benefits

 - Flexible vacation policy

 - Unlimited credits to stay at Kindred homes during your time as an employee

 - $4,000 annual travel stipend to use toward travel costs to stay at a Kindred home

 - Remote-flexible work environment. We encourage team members to travel and adventure, including working from Kindred HQ in San Francisco!

 - Regular offsites to co-locate with the team

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. Kindred does not discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic, including race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, genetic information, family care or medical leave status, marital status, domestic partner status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by US federal, state or local laws, or the laws of the country or jurisdiction where you work. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

jobs.title: Senior Counsel, Commercial and Product Legal
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Kindred is a members-only home swapping network that unlocks the ability to live a travel-rich lifestyle through the power of community. By exchanging primary residences with trusted peers, renters and owners alike can match with Kindred spirits and explore new destinations without breaking the bank.

We are on a mission to build a sharing economy that lives up to the name, and we’ve raised significant capital from some of the best investors in Silicon Valley, including Index Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, New Enterprise Associates, Bessemer Venture Partners, Caffeinated Capital, Elad Gil, and the founders of Opendoor, Figma, ClassPass, Clubhouse, Divvy, Gem, and Homebound.

The co-founders are proven leaders from the early team at proptech company Opendoor ($15B+ exit) and have each separately built and scaled products that today do $1B+ annual revenue combined.

We’re looking for the world’s top builders, executors, and believers to join us on this ride.

You can learn more about us in Forbes and TechCrunch.

The Role:

You will be our first legal team hire, reporting directly to our General Counsel to support our Product/Tech, Operations, and Marketing teams. This role requires someone with deep B2C marketplace experience who can navigate the complex regulatory landscape facing two-sided platforms while enabling rapid business growth. Given the evolving nature of our legal needs as we scale, you'll need to be comfortable providing support across multiple practice areas, with primary focus on product and operations teams and occasional marketing support. This remote role can be based anywhere in the US, with a preference for candidates located near our HQ in San Francisco, CA or in PST for collaboration purposes.

What You'll Do:

Product & Operations

  • Partner with product teams on feature launches and user experience legal requirements

  • Maintain and evolve terms of service, community standards, and other platform policies

  • Partner with Trust & Safety to develop frameworks for dispute resolution, content moderation, and incident response

  • Advise on platform liability issues and intermediary protections

Regulatory & Compliance

  • Navigate regulatory compliance across key markets in North America and the EU including consumer protection laws, privacy requirements, and lodging regulations

  • Provide occasional marketing compliance support, including platform advertising and promotional terms

Commercial & Partnership Legal

  • Lead contract negotiations for technology partnerships, marketing vendor agreements, and emerging supplier marketplace relationships

You may be a right fit for this role if you:

  • JD and bar admission in relevant jurisdiction

  • 7-10 years overall legal experience with 4+ years in-house experience at B2C technology companies. (Candidates with 5-6 years of highly relevant marketplace experience may be considered for a Counsel-level role.)

  • Two-sided marketplace or platform experience strongly preferred

  • Trust and safety, content moderation, or platform liability experience

  • Experience providing guidance on domestic and international privacy requirements, including GDPR and CCPA

  • Product legal experience including regulatory compliance guidance and developing customer-facing policies

  • Experience supporting marketing initiatives, including partnerships and promotions

  • Crisis management experience with platform incidents or regulatory matters

  • Demonstrated ability to exercise independent judgment and balance legal risk with business objectives

  • Demonstrated experience in effective cross-functional collaboration

Preferred Qualifications

  • Early career law firm experience (2-3 years) in technology or transactional practice

  • International expansion experience

  • Experience with high growth startup environments and scaling challenges

Our Benefits:

At Kindred, we know that good things happen when we look out for one another. We offer our employees the following benefits:

  • Our opening spans more than one career level. The base salary offered depends on many factors, such as work experience, transferable skills, business needs and impact, and market demands.

  • A vibrant, inclusive, and highly skilled team that ferociously protects team chemistry

  • A culture of championship (vs. just mentorship), feedback, and continual development

  • Competitive cash compensation and equity

  • Comprehensive health benefits

  • Flexible vacation policy

  • Unlimited credits to stay at Kindred homes during your time as an employee

  • $4,000 annual travel stipend to use toward travel costs to stay at a Kindred home

  • Remote-flexible work environment. We encourage team members to travel and adventure, including working from Kindred HQ in San Francisco!

  • Regular offsites to co-locate with the team

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. Kindred does not discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic, including race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, genetic information, family care or medical leave status, marital status, domestic partner status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by US federal, state or local laws, or the laws of the country or jurisdiction where you work. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

 - A culture of championship (vs. just mentorship), feedback, and continual development

 - Competitive cash compensation and equity

 - Comprehensive health benefits

 - Flexible vacation policy

 - Unlimited credits to stay at Kindred homes during your time as an employee

 - $4,000 annual travel stipend to use toward travel costs to stay at a Kindred home

 - Remote-flexible work environment. We encourage team members to travel and adventure, including working from Kindred HQ in San Francisco!

 - Regular offsites to co-locate with the team

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. Kindred does not discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic, including race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, genetic information, family care or medical leave status, marital status, domestic partner status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by US federal, state or local laws, or the laws of the country or jurisdiction where you work. jobs.title: Senior / Staff Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Kindred is a members-only home swapping network that unlocks the ability to live a travel-rich lifestyle through the power of community. By exchanging primary residences with trusted peers, renters and owners alike can match with Kindred spirits and explore new destinations without breaking the bank.

We are on a mission to build a sharing economy that lives up to the name, and we’ve raised significant capital from some of the best investors in Silicon Valley, including Index Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, New Enterprise Associates, Bessemer Venture Partners, Caffeinated Capital, Elad Gil, and the founders of Opendoor, Figma, ClassPass, Clubhouse, Divvy, Gem, and Homebound.

The co-founders are proven leaders from the early team at proptech company Opendoor ($15B+ exit) and have each separately built and scaled products that today do $1B+ annual revenue combined.

We’re looking for the world’s top builders, executors, and believers to join us on this ride.

You can learn more about us in Forbes and TechCrunch.

The Role:

Kindred is looking for a Senior / Staff Product Designer to help build the future of travel. In this role, you'll work closely with our co-founders and cross-functional leaders to drive and shape the core member experience at Kindred. You'll own end-to-end projects in a fast-paced environment, engaging across all stages of a project – including prototyping, service design, information design, workshop facilitation, and user research.

We appreciate designers who care deeply about the user experience as well as the visual pixels, and feels comfortable wearing many hats to ship a delightful experience. The ideal designer for this team has experience building community-oriented consumer products.

All product design applications must link to work samples or include a portfolio.

What You’ll Do:

  • Actively practice and evangelize customer-centric thinking

  • Own, lead and drive design problems from research and ideation through to execution

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, and showcase your vision and rationale behind design decisions to stakeholders

  • Use quantitative data and qualitative feedback to inform the design decisions iteratively

  • Identify future opportunities, working as a key thought partner to product

You may be a right fit for this role if you:

  • Have at least 8+ years of experience in product design, at least some of which are in consumer product design

  • Have mobile app and web app design experience

  • Demonstrated ability to tackle complex user and design problems

  • Have a keen eye for visual design

  • Are Interested in qualitative and quantitative data. You care deeply about grounding decisions in real data

  • Have an owner's attitude. You don’t hesitate to initiate spontaneous research, you empower engineers to get the fit and finish right, and you translate insights from research into meaningful action

  • Know when to apply the appropriate level of fidelity to your work, being conscious of deadlines & deliverables to communicate your solution

Bonus Points:

  • You have a mix of experience in consumer and B2B product design

  • You have had a mix of experience in startups, large companies, and/or agencies

  • You have experience designing social media products

  • You have experience in, or take an interest in design outside of product design (illustration, brand, motion, photography)

  • You have experience with building design systems

  • You had experience as a manager and/or mentor

  • A track record of leading 0-1 initiatives

Our Benefits:

At Kindred, we know that good things happen when we look out for one another. We offer our employees the following benefits:

  • Our opening spans more than one career level. The base salary offered depends on many factors, such as work experience, transferable skills, business needs and impact, and market demands.

  • A vibrant, inclusive, and highly skilled team that ferociously protects team chemistry

  • A culture of championship (vs. just mentorship), feedback, and continual development

  • Competitive cash compensation and equity

  • Comprehensive health benefits

  • Flexible vacation policy

  • Unlimited credits to stay at Kindred homes during your time as an employee

  • $4,000 annual travel stipend to use toward travel costs to stay at a Kindred home

  • Remote-flexible work environment. We encourage team members to travel and adventure, including working from Kindred HQ in San Francisco!

  • Regular offsites to co-locate with the team

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. Kindred does not discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic, including race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, genetic information, family care or medical leave status, marital status, domestic partner status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by US federal, state or local laws, or the laws of the country or jurisdiction where you work. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

jobs.title: Staff Data Scientist, Marketing Analytics
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Kindred is a members-only home swapping network that unlocks the ability to live a travel-rich lifestyle through the power of community. By exchanging primary residences with trusted peers, renters and owners alike can match with Kindred spirits and explore new destinations without breaking the bank.

We are on a mission to build a sharing economy that lives up to the name, and we’ve raised significant capital from some of the best investors in Silicon Valley, including Index Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, New Enterprise Associates, Bessemer Venture Partners, Caffeinated Capital, Elad Gil, and the founders of Opendoor, Figma, ClassPass, Clubhouse, Divvy, Gem, and Homebound.

The co-founders are proven leaders from the early team at proptech company Opendoor ($15B+ exit) and have each separately built and scaled products that today do $1B+ annual revenue combined.

We’re looking for the world’s top builders, executors, and believers to join us on this ride.

You can learn more about us in Forbes and TechCrunch.

The Role

As the founding Staff Data Scientist for Marketing Analytics, you will be a strategic partner and thought leader driving our member growth strategy. You will be the dedicated data partner to the Marketing leadership team, responsible for shaping our measurement strategy, guiding investment decisions, and building our marketing data foundations from the ground up.

This is a hybrid role that requires not only deep analytical insight and predictive modeling but also the ability to deconstruct ambiguous business goals into a clear, data-driven roadmap. You will be instrumental in defining how we measure success and influencing the direction of a multi-million dollar marketing budget.

What You'll Do

  • Act as a Strategic Thought Partner: Partner directly with the Head of Marketing and other leaders to frame key business problems, define our marketing measurement strategy, and guide investment decisions.

  • Define and Own Marketing Measurement: Move beyond dashboards to establish the frameworks for measuring our entire marketing funnel, from top-of-funnel brand investments to bottom-funnel activation and long-term value.

  • Lead and Scale Marketing Experimentation: Design, execute, and analyze complex incrementality tests (e.g., geo-lift studies, multi-cell experiments) to determine the true causal impact of new strategies, channels, and brand campaigns.

  • Pioneer Foundational Marketing Science Models: Build and deploy sophisticated models for member LTV prediction, marketing mix modeling (MMM), and multi-touch attribution to drive sustainable and efficient growth.

  • Drive Strategy with Insights: Conduct deep-dive analyses into marketplace dynamics, understanding the trade-offs between acquisition, activation, and network liquidity to inform a holistic growth strategy.

  • Influence and Educate: Translate complex analytical concepts into clear, actionable recommendations and effectively persuade senior stakeholders to adopt data-informed strategies, even when the data is inconvenient.

What We're Looking For

  • Experience: 8+ years of experience in a quantitative role such as marketing analytics or data science, with a proven track record of influencing strategy at a leadership level, preferably within a consumer tech or marketplace company.

  • Technical Skills:

    • Expert-level proficiency in SQL.

    • Advanced programming skills in Python or R for statistical analysis and modeling.

    • Experience with a BI tool such as Mode, Metabase, or Looker.

    • Familiarity with modern data warehouses.

  • Analytical & Strategic Skills:

    • Strategic Problem Framing: You are a systems-thinker who excels at deconstructing ambiguous business goals (e.g., "grow revenue by 20%") into a clear, measurable, and phased data-driven plan.

    • Deep Expertise in Causal Inference: You have hands-on experience designing and executing quasi-experiments to measure the "unmeasurable," such as the ROI of brand marketing, using techniques like geo-based lift studies, Difference-in-Differences, or Media Mix Modeling (MMM).

    • Business Acumen & Investment Guidance: You can frame complex trade-offs (e.g., short-term performance vs. long-term brand building) as portfolio optimization problems and create decision frameworks to guide leadership on multi-million dollar investment decisions.

    • Leadership & Influence: You have exceptional communication skills, with a proven ability to simplify complex concepts and persuade senior stakeholders to trust the data and embrace new measurement strategies.

  • Mindset:

    • You are a proactive, self-starting individual who is comfortable with ambiguity and excited to build a foundational data science function from scratch in a fast-paced environment.

    • You are defined by the quality of your questions and your relentless curiosity to understand the "why" behind the data.

Our Benefits:

At Kindred, we know that good things happen when we look out for one another. We offer our employees the following benefits:

  • Our opening spans more than one career level. The base salary offered depends on many factors, such as work experience, transferable skills, business needs and impact, and market demands.

  • A vibrant, inclusive, and highly skilled team that ferociously protects team chemistry

  • A culture of championship (vs. just mentorship), feedback, and continual development

  • Competitive cash compensation and equity

  • Comprehensive health benefits

  • Flexible vacation policy

  • Unlimited credits to stay at Kindred homes during your time as an employee

  • $4,000 annual travel stipend to use toward travel costs to stay at a Kindred home

  • Remote-flexible work environment. We encourage team members to travel and adventure, including working from Kindred HQ in San Francisco!

  • Regular offsites to co-locate with the team

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. Kindred does not discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic, including race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, genetic information, family care or medical leave status, marital status, domestic partner status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by US federal, state or local laws, or the laws of the country or jurisdiction where you work. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
jobs.descriptionPlain:
Kindred is a members-only home swapping network that unlocks the ability to live a travel-rich lifestyle through the power of community. By exchanging primary residences with trusted peers, renters and owners alike can match with Kindred spirits and explore new destinations without breaking the bank.

We are on a mission to build a sharing economy that lives up to the name, and we’ve raised significant capital from some of the best investors in Silicon Valley, including Index Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, New Enterprise Associates, Bessemer Venture Partners, Caffeinated Capital, Elad Gil, and the founders of Opendoor, Figma, ClassPass, Clubhouse, Divvy, Gem, and Homebound.

The co-founders are proven leaders from the early team at proptech company Opendoor ($15B+ exit) and have each separately built and scaled products that today do $1B+ annual revenue combined.

We’re looking for the world’s top builders, executors, and believers to join us on this ride.

You can learn more about us in Forbes https://www.forbes.com/sites/bridgetarsenault/2022/06/10/a-new-home-swapping-platform-allows-you-to-travel-the-world-like-cameron-diaz-and-kate-winslet/?sh=203a5d0722cb and TechCrunch https://techcrunch.com/2023/04/19/opendoor-alums-raise-15m-for-kindred-a-home-swapping-network/.


THE ROLE

As the founding Staff Data Scientist for Marketing Analytics, you will be a strategic partner and thought leader driving our member growth strategy. You will be the dedicated data partner to the Marketing leadership team, responsible for shaping our measurement strategy, guiding investment decisions, and building our marketing data foundations from the ground up.

This is a hybrid role that requires not only deep analytical insight and predictive modeling but also the ability to deconstruct ambiguous business goals into a clear, data-driven roadmap. You will be instrumental in defining how we measure success and influencing the direction of a multi-million dollar marketing budget.


WHAT YOU'LL DO

 - Act as a Strategic Thought Partner: Partner directly with the Head of Marketing and other leaders to frame key business problems, define our marketing measurement strategy, and guide investment decisions.

 - Define and Own Marketing Measurement: Move beyond dashboards to establish the frameworks for measuring our entire marketing funnel, from top-of-funnel brand investments to bottom-funnel activation and long-term value.

 - Lead and Scale Marketing Experimentation: Design, execute, and analyze complex incrementality tests (e.g., geo-lift studies, multi-cell experiments) to determine the true causal impact of new strategies, channels, and brand campaigns.

 - Pioneer Foundational Marketing Science Models: Build and deploy sophisticated models for member LTV prediction, marketing mix modeling (MMM), and multi-touch attribution to drive sustainable and efficient growth.

 - Drive Strategy with Insights: Conduct deep-dive analyses into marketplace dynamics, understanding the trade-offs between acquisition, activation, and network liquidity to inform a holistic growth strategy.

 - Influence and Educate: Translate complex analytical concepts into clear, actionable recommendations and effectively persuade senior stakeholders to adopt data-informed strategies, even when the data is inconvenient.


WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

 - Experience: 8+ years of experience in a quantitative role such as marketing analytics or data science, with a proven track record of influencing strategy at a leadership level, preferably within a consumer tech or marketplace company.

 - Technical Skills:
   
   - Expert-level proficiency in SQL.
   
   - Advanced programming skills in Python or R for statistical analysis and modeling.
   
   - Experience with a BI tool such as Mode, Metabase, or Looker.
   
   - Familiarity with modern data warehouses.

 - Analytical & Strategic Skills:
   
   - Strategic Problem Framing: You are a systems-thinker who excels at deconstructing ambiguous business goals (e.g., "grow revenue by 20%") into a clear, measurable, and phased data-driven plan.
   
   - Deep Expertise in Causal Inference: You have hands-on experience designing and executing quasi-experiments to measure the "unmeasurable," such as the ROI of brand marketing, using techniques like geo-based lift studies, Difference-in-Differences, or Media Mix Modeling (MMM).
   
   - Business Acumen & Investment Guidance: You can frame complex trade-offs (e.g., short-term performance vs. long-term brand building) as portfolio optimization problems and create decision frameworks to guide leadership on multi-million dollar investment decisions.
   
   - Leadership & Influence: You have exceptional communication skills, with a proven ability to simplify complex concepts and persuade senior stakeholders to trust the data and embrace new measurement strategies.

 - Mindset:
   
   - You are a proactive, self-starting individual who is comfortable with ambiguity and excited to build a foundational data science function from scratch in a fast-paced environment.
   
   - You are defined by the quality of your questions and your relentless curiosity to understand the "why" behind the data.


OUR BENEFITS:

At Kindred, we know that good things happen when we look out for one another. We offer our employees the following benefits:

 - Our opening spans more than one career level. The base salary offered depends on many factors, such as work experience, transferable skills, business needs and impact, and market demands.

 - A vibrant, inclusive, and highly skilled team that ferociously protects team chemistry

 - A culture of championship (vs. just mentorship), feedback, and continual development

 - Competitive cash compensation and equity

 - Comprehensive health benefits

 - Flexible vacation policy

 - Unlimited credits to stay at Kindred homes during your time as an employee

 - $4,000 annual travel stipend to use toward travel costs to stay at a Kindred home

 - Remote-flexible work environment. We encourage team members to travel and adventure, including working from Kindred HQ in San Francisco!

 - Regular offsites to co-locate with the team

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. Kindred does not discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic, including race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical condition, genetic information, family care or medical leave status, marital status, domestic partner status, military and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by US federal, state or local laws, or the laws of the country or jurisdiction where you work. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
